Text 5.5.5: The convex hull of an arbitrary collection of functions {f_i | sorry sorry} : Set ?m.1{f_i | Unknown identifier `i`i Unknown identifier `I`I} on ^ sorry : Type^Unknown identifier `n`n is denoted Unknown identifier `conv`conv {f_i | i I}. It is the function obtained via Theorem 5.3 from the convex hull of the union of the epigraphs of the Unknown identifier `f_i`f_i.

noncomputable def convexHullFunctionFamily {n : Nat} { : Sort _} (f : (Fin n Real) EReal) : (Fin n Real) EReal := fun x => sInf ((fun : => ( : EReal)) '' { : | (x, ) convexHull ( i, epigraph (S := (Set.univ : Set (Fin n Real))) (f i)) })
